I happened upon the solution to this:
Create a base test class which extends from
AbstractDependencyInjectionSpringContextTests, overriding getConfigLocations
to define the location of the context file in one place only.

http://static.springsource.org/spring/docs/2.0.x/api/org/springframework/test/AbstractDependencyInjectionSpringContextTests.html

Tom.


Tom Corcoran wrote:
> 
> I am using JUnit 4 annotations to run my tests.
> 
> @RunWith(SpringJUnit4ClassRunner.class)  
> @ContextConfiguration(locations =
> "file:src/test/resources/test-applicationContext.xml")
> 
> It's not very DRY to have to copy @ContextConfiguration into every test.
> Other than going back to JUnit 3 and extending TestCase again is their
> another option to constantly repeating
> @ContextConfiguration(locations =
> "file:src/test/resources/test-applicationContext.xml")?
> 
> 
>
